content:
(interpreter) unknown declaration '_eval'

failed to compile definition, compiler IR check failed at '_eval'. Error: depends on declaration 'Real.sin', which has no executable code; consider marking definition as 'noncomputable'

i was trying to demonstrate some basic trigonomatrics, but #eval (Real.sin 3)^2 + (Real.cos 3)^2 failed with the above error message.

i understand the taylor-serie definition somehow cannot be transfered back to a printable form, but do not fully understand the issue or how to resolve it

thanks in advance!

Your full name said:

i understand the taylor-serie definition somehow cannot be transfered back to a printable form

well looks like you completely understand the issue
what mathematicians refer to as "eval" and what lean thinks is "eval" are different things
but we often forget that it's a theorem and not an automatic fact
but to Lean, "automatically guessing a theorem that applies in this case" is a useless algorithm
a human would fail if the 2 are replaced with 3
